attachmentHtml:
PC Number: 2011-0025

Date: 2011-01-24

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 43(1) of the Broadcasting Act, hereby fixes the salary of Hubert Lacroix, President, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($352,100 - $414,300), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council,on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(1) of the Canada Council Act, hereby fixes the salary of Robert Sirman, Director, Canada Council for the Arts, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($203,800 - $239,800), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby fixes the salary of Victor Rabinovitch, Director, Canadian Museum of Civilization, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($203,800 - $239,800), effective April 1, 2010 and April 3, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Stuart A. Murray, Director, Canadian Museum for Human Rights, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 12(1) of the Canadian Film Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of S. Wayne Clarkson, former Executive Director, Telefilm Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($200,700 - $236,200), effective January 16, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Joanne V. DiCosimo, former Director, Canadian Museum of Nature, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 6(3) of the National Arts Centre Act, hereby fixes the salary of Peter Herrndorf, President, National Arts Centre Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($182,400 - $214,700), effective September 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Marc Mayer, Director, National Gallery of Canada, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 23(5) of the Museums Act, hereby approves the salary of Denise Amyot, Director, National Museum of Science and Technology, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 11 of the Canadian Race Relations Foundation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ayman Al-Yassini, Executive Director, Canadian Race Relations Foundation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($118,000 - $138,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Guy Saint-Pierre, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($227,900 - $268,100), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to section 6 of the Freshwater Fish Marketing Act, hereby fixes the salary of John Wood, President, Freshwater Fish Marketing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($148,100 - $174,200), effective May 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(2) of the Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation Act, hereby fixes the salary of Karen Kinsley, President, Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 7 ($352,100 - $414,300), effective January 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Hugh MacDiarmid, President and Chief Executive Officer, Atomic Energy of Canada Limited at the rate set out in the schedule hereto, which rate is within the salary range ($337,800 - $397,400), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ross Nicholls, former President and Chief Executive Officer, Defence Construction (1951) Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($167,300 - $196,900), effective September 3, 2009.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of James Paul, President and Chief Executive Officer, Defence Construction (1951) Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act and section 7 of the Crown Corporation General Regulations, 1995, hereby fixes the salary of Charles Chrapko, President and Chief Executive Officer, Blue Water Bridge Authority as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 1 ($118,000 - $138,900), effective September 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Mark B. Laroche, President and Chief Executive Officer, Canada Lands Company Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($212,600 - $250,100), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 21 (2) of the Canadian Air Transport Security Authority Act, hereby fixes the salary of Kevin McGarr, Chief Executive Officer, Canadian Air Transport Security Authority, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 4 ($203,800 - $239,800), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Micheline Dubé, Chief Executive Officer, Federal Bridge Corporation Limited, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Wayne M. Follett, President and Chief Executive Officer, Marine Atlantic Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 3 ($169,900 - $199,900), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 16(1) of the Royal Canadian Mint Act, hereby fixes the salary of Ian E. Bennett, Master of the Mint, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($281,400 - $331,000), effective January 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 7(1) of the National Capital Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marie Lemay, Chief Executive Officer, National Capital Commission, as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range ($212,600 - $250,100), effective April 1, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Marc Laliberté, President and Chief Executive Officer, VIA Rail Canada Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 5 ($244,500 - $287,700), effective January 4, 2010.

 

   His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Prime Minister, pursuant to subsection 108(1) of the Financial Administration Act, hereby fixes the salary of Paul Côté, former President and Chief Executive Officer, VIA Rail Canada Inc., as set out in the schedule hereto, which salary is within the range CEO 5 ($244,500 - $287,700), effective January 1, 2010.
